intro: Sanguinella, commonly known as the bloodroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, often reddish, sap that can be toxic. The plants typically have a single, basal leaf and a short stem with a single flower. Sanguinella species are native to various parts of the world, including Europe, Asia, and North America. They are often found in woodland areas and are known for their ornamental value and medicinal properties.
